question: 私
sourceAnswer:
<read>わたし</read>:: I/me
<read>わたくし</read>:: I/me | personal-(affairs,-etc.)/private | selfishness/partiality | secrecy/confidentiality
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you're lucky, you already know this (very) common word's reading. It's the word for "I," probably one of the first things you'd learn in Japanese. The reading for this is <ja><reading>わたし</reading></ja>. If you don't know that already, just think: "<reading>What, a <ja>し</ja></reading>?" referring to the reading of the kanji, which is <ja>し</ja>.
